summary: The Kerala Service Rules amendment, effective September 1, 2014, and formally ordered on February 20, 2019, via G.O. (P) No. 16/2019/FIN, modifies rules 90 and 118 to include grandparents as eligible guardians for minor children of deceased government employees, streamlining payment of family pension and Death-cum-Retirement Gratuity/share.

The Kerala Service Rules amendment, issued through G.O. (P) No. 18/2019/FIN on February 20, 2019, with an effective date of July 26, 2016, modifies Rule 90(6) by omitting items (j) and (k) and Note 4, and revising Note 5 to update referenced items and increase a figure from '15,000' to '30,000'.

The Kerala Service Rules were amended by Government Order G.O. (P) No. 18/2019/FIN dated February 20, 2019, effective April 1, 2015, to modify Rule 90(6A) by changing the figure '15,000' to '30,000' in sub-rule (6A) clause (1).

The Kerala Service Rules were amended by Government Order G.O. (P) No. 18/2019/FIN dated February 20, 2019, to omit the word "unmarried" in condition (i) of the proviso to sub-rule (7) of Rule 90, with an effective date of April 18, 2012.

The Kerala Service Rules were amended via G.O. (P) No. 19/2019/FIN, effective as of August 29, 2016, to add a new instruction requiring details of whether an appointment is in merit quota or reservation quota to be entered in the Service Book, thereby giving statutory validity to a previous order dated August 29, 2016.

The Kerala Service Rules amendment, as per G.O. (P) No. 20/2019/FIN dated February 22, 2019, revises pension provisions under Rule 63 to ensure that eligible employees receive at least 50% of the minimum revised scale pay if their revised pension is less, with proportional amounts for those not eligible for full pension based on qualifying service, effective July 1, 2004.

The Kerala Service Rules were amended via order G.O. (P) No. 20/2019/FIN on February 22, 2019, to extend Note 10 benefits to employees with pre-revised pay in average emoluments due to leave without allowance up to 4 months, effective July 1, 2014, as per the newly added 'Note 10A' under Rule 63.

The Kerala Service Rules were amended via order G.O. (P) No. 26/2019/FIN dated March 7, 2019, to change the amount in Rule 68 from '7 lakhs' to '14 lakhs', with the amendment being effective as of July 1, 2014.

The Kerala Service Rules amendment, ordered through G.O. (P) No. 26/2019/FIN on March 7, 2019, and effective as of July 1, 2014, modifies Rule 90 by changing various monetary values in sub-rules 4CC and 7, specifically updating figures such as '4,500' to '8,500', '17,960' to '36,000', '50% of ₹59,840' to '50% of ₹1,20,000', and '30% of ₹59,840' to '30% of ₹1,20,000'.

The Kerala Service Rules were amended by Government Order G.O. (P) No. 52/2019/FIN on May 3, 2019, to add "leave connected to inquiry into sexual harassment" after "child adoption leave" in sub-rule (ii) of rule 77, with the change being effective as of August 31, 2017.

The Kerala Service Rules have been amended to add Rule 102 C, which provides up to 90 days of paid leave to female employees during an inquiry into sexual harassment, effective August 31, 2017, as per Government Order G.O. (P) No. 52/2019/FIN dated May 3, 2019.

The Kerala Service Rules have been amended with effect from July 9, 2019, through G.O. (P) No. 82/2019/FIN, to add a new sub-rule (d) to Rule 59, allowing for disciplinary action to be initiated against retired employees who committed offences while in service but received pensionary benefits without facing disciplinary action.
The Kerala Service Rules were amended by Government Order G.O. (P) No. 123/2019/FIN dated September 6, 2019, effective July 16, 2014, to omit the words "scale of" from Note 5 to Rule 62.

The Kerala Service Rules were amended by Government Order G.O. (P) No. 123/2019/FIN dated September 6, 2019, effective July 16, 2014, to omit the words "scale of" from Note 2 to sub-rule (5) of rule 90.

The Kerala Service Rules were amended via order G.O. (P) No. 125/2019/FIN dated September 6, 2019, to change "Form 2" to "Form 2B" in clause (vi) of sub-rule (13) of Rule 90, with the amendment being effective as of June 29, 2015.
The Kerala Service Rules were amended via order G.O. (P) No. 125/2019/FIN dated September 6, 2019, to change 'Form 11' to 'Form 2A' in Rule 110, with the change being effective as of June 29, 2015.

The Kerala Service Rules were amended by Government Order G.O. (P) No. 125/2019/FIN dated September 6, 2019, to change "Form 2" to "Form 2B" in sub-clause (ii) of clause (b) of Rule 113, with the amendment being effective from June 29, 2015.

The Kerala Service Rules amendment, ordered through G.O. (P) No. 125/2019/FIN on September 6, 2019, with an effective date of June 29, 2015, modifies Rule 115 by changing 'Form 2' to 'Form 2B' in clauses (b), (c)(i), and (c)(ii).

The Kerala Service Rules were amended by Government Order G.O. (P) No. 125/2019/FIN on September 6, 2019, effective June 29, 2015, to revise Rule 117 by changing 'Form 2' to 'Form 2B' in sub-rule (1).

The Kerala Service Rules amendment, as per G.O. (P) No. 125/2019/FIN dated September 6, 2019, with an effective date of June 29, 2015, adds a provision to Rule 4 of Part A in Appendix X, requiring applicants to submit forms 2A and 2B for commutation of pension within one year from the date of retirement.

The Kerala Service Rules amendment, as per G.O. (P) No. 125/2019/FIN dated September 6, 2019, with an effective date of June 29, 2015, modifies Form 2A to include detailed application information for pension and commutation, personal and retirement details, and required attachments, now titled "Formal application for Pension and Commutation".

The Kerala Service Rules amendment, as per G.O. (P) No. 125/2019/FIN dated September 6, 2019, with an effective date of June 29, 2015, introduces a new Form 2B for formal application of multiple pension benefits, including Pension, Gratuity, Death-Cum Retirement Gratuity, Family Pension, and Commutation of pension, which encompasses personal, service, and treasury details, among others.

The Kerala Service Rules were amended by Government Order G.O. (P) No. 126/2019/FIN, dated September 18, 2019, to take immediate effect, specifically omitting the words "extraordinary pension or" from Rule 88 in Part III, Chapter VI.

The Kerala Service Rules were amended effective immediately as of September 18, 2019, via order G.O. (P) No. 126/2019/FIN, which modified Rule 90 by omitting the words "and Extraordinary pension admissible under the rules in Appendix XIII of Part III of this rule" from sub-rule (11).

The Kerala Service Rules were amended effective immediately as of September 18, 2019, by Government Order G.O. (P) No. 126/2019/FIN, which omitted specific words related to extraordinary pension from Rule 93 in Part III, Chapter VI.

The Kerala Service Rules have been amended with immediate effect as per Government Order G.O. (P) No. 126/2019/FIN dated September 18, 2019, which revises Rule 102 by adding the phrase "awarded under the Defense Service Rules" to the ruling below the rule regarding pension eligibility.

The Kerala Service Rules amendment, as per G.O. (P) No. 126/2019/FIN dated September 18, 2019, immediately omitted Chapter VI and Appendix XIII entirely due to the implementation of other welfare schemes like Group Personal Accident Insurance Scheme and Ex gratia Payment, which led to the withdrawal of the extraordinary pension scheme except for Defense Service Rules related cases.

The Kerala Service Rules were amended via order G.O. (P) No. 127/2019/FIN on September 19, 2019, to change the duplicate Pension Payment Order fee from "rupees Two" to "rupees Two hundred and fifty", effective September 23, 2016, as per Rule 134.

The Kerala Service Rules were amended via order G.O. (P) No. 127/2019/FIN on September 19, 2019, to change the duplicate Pension Payment Order fee from "rupees Two hundred and fifty" to "rupees Two hundred and sixty five", with an effective date of March 17, 2018, as per Rule 134.

The Kerala Service Rules amendment, issued through G.O. (P) No. 165/2019/FIN on November 27, 2019, revises Rule 31 to state that interruptions in service do not count towards pension unless condoned, with an exception for strikes treated as 'Dies-Non', and also deletes Government Decision No.8 below Rule 14E Part III KSRs, effective December 16, 2009.
